title: It looks like Engravers Old English but The E and C are different. C has two extra lines on it. Trying to figure out what font this is.
author: emerby

comments.content:
Everything BUT the |E|and |C| appears to be Xanthippe, by Nick Curtis:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/xanthippe-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073112/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/xanthippe-nf/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/xanthippe-nf/")

Haven’t found a spot-on match for the initial caps—may be customized from a variant of Old English.

EDITED:  
A true mystery. The usually reliable reference for the source of Nick's Fonts [http://home.kpn.nl/savoogt1963/FontSources.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073112/http:/home.kpn.nl/savoogt1963/FontSources.htm "http://home.kpn.nl/savoogt1963/FontSources.htm") states that the lowercase of Xanthippe is unknown.  
Some variant of a "titling text" by a 19th century foundry. But which one?  
Since writing this I checked and found some similar fonts but nothing spot on.  
I wonder where Nick saw the font with the lower case.  
Don

Interesting substitute similar font for the upper case Ruca

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RucaAsElCajon_4974.gif)
  [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/ruca/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214073112/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/ruca/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/ruca/") particularly for the \_E\_.  
Don
